subject: Design
title: The Fitted Kitchen: Efficiency by Design
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Fitted Kitchen: Efficiency by Design.

hook.text: In 1926, Margarete SchÃ¼tte-Lihotzky designed a kitchen so efficient it fit in 65 square feet.

buildup.text: The Frankfurt Kitchen used time-motion studies to minimize steps between stove, sink, and counter.

discovery.text: Every drawer, shelf, and surface was placed based on how a cook actually moves during meal prep.

twist.text: 10,000 Frankfurt Kitchens were installed in public housing. It was the first mass-produced interior.
